title: Cannot access a certain website
content: Hi, I have been a member for nearly 20 years now with a certain Website, pineconeresearch.com aka: Pinecone Research. It is a survey site that I have been using for a very long time, and I am a very loyal member of theirs. I have never run into these issues (honestly not until this new administration/government took over full power). I am an American born and live in the USA. I have always been able to login at their site at any given time, for nearly 20 years now. I receive emails from them, but I cannot access anything about them at my end. I cannot reply to emails, cannot directly email them, cannot call them, and cannot login at their Website. Cannot access help pages through their links etc... I do Internet searches and find lots of info, but everything leads back to needing to access pineconeresearch to get any answers. So I am lost for thoughts and words at the moment. Whats worse is members accumulate points/money at their site and we are able to cash out at any given time as well, for our incentive/rewards (mine usually goes to my PayPal acct. or you can pick rewards like gift cards etc... So now I cannot even login to cash out and I have quite a bit accumulated over a long period of time, work, and effort. So I do hope I can get an answer as to what the heck is going on with their Website? I have no other issues with my new Dell Desktop PC. I have used a PC for 25 years now so I am not illiterate either. I keep my PC nice and clean, and I know all about fixing common PC issues with browsers, cached files, browser history, cookies, etc... even simply rebooting any PC will fix most issues. This is something else. Hoping & praying you can please help with some solid info and thank you very much.

title: Firefox Menu Disappears after using Hot Corners on macOS
content:
The Firefox menu (at the top above the browser window: File, Edit, View, etc.) disappears when I use a Hot Corner on macOS to Mission Control. See attached screenshot, I blacked out (with green) the open tabs.

If I go to Mission Control again, the FF menu then reappears.

FF is the only application to which this happens. And it seems to have started one or two FF updates ago. (Within the past 2/3 weeks).

macOS 15.3.2 FF 136.0.4 (aarch64).

Any thoughts as to how/ why this is happening and how to prevent it? It is not affecting performance but is a little annoying. This happens on a MacBook Pro M3, MacBook Air M4, and a MacStudio M1.

Thanks for your time and help!

title: Firefox opening partially full screen
content:
System: Linux/Fedora41 Firefox: 136.0.4 Monitor: Acer 27" 1920x1080

When I open a FF window, it opens full screen vertically and to some width horizontally, both dimensions not desired. My usual style (for the MANY years I have used FF and Linux) is to use a FF window that is NOT full screen in either dimension since I normally have multiple windows open simultaneously. This FF behavior has started just recently.

This behavior occurs when starting FF from the FF icon on the desktop, when opening a new window from the FF main menu, or when opening a new window via the 'Open Link in New Window". (Perhaps other ways as well: these are those I encountered.)

I have tried: .... Opening FF/resize window to desired size/close FF using 'Quit': no change on restart .... Deleting the xulstore.json in the profile folder/restarting FF: no change on restart

I would like to restore FF to its previous action: open new windows at the same size as the last one referenced. Can someone help?

Thanks.

Bill Lee

title: Missing Bookmarks, Bookmark Toolbar and Customized Firefox Homepage
content:
Apparently Firefox did an update (version 136.0.4) in the background while I was using Firefox on March 27. At some point I wanted to save a page to my bookmarks and realized all my bookmarks were missing. I had just used bookmarks earlier, so it had to have been an update. This happened to me before back in January 2025. I was without my bookmarks for several weeks when all of a sudden they showed up again.

I cannot use the instructions to go back to a previous profile, as the two options showing do not have my bookmarks, bookmark toolbar or customized Firefox homepage. I also cannot import my saved bookmarks to get them back. I get an error message when I attempt to do that option.

This is very frustrating, as I use my bookmarks, toolbar and customized homepage EVERY day. I have all my important links saved to bookmarks. Firefox developers need to find out why an update removes bookmarks, as this seems to be an ongoing issue with me. I've used Firefox for over 17+ years and never had bookmarks removed after an update before, so something in an update is causing this issue.

I have no idea at this point IF everything will return to normal in a few weeks like it did back in January. So right now I am without all my bookmarks. Please get this ongoing issue resolved, it's a royal pain. I need those bookmarks to maintain my daily routine for accessing financials, medical websites, etc.

Thanks for any help you can give me at this point. This is the second time it has happened.
creator: Kyli902

title: Google Map is not displaying/loading in geckofx browser control embeeded in .net wpf window app
content: Hi team, I have created a web application using angularJs(angualr 1) and html in which a web page displays google map.it is working perfectly when we open in Firefox and chrome browse. I have created a wpf window application using .net framework 4.6.1 and embedded geckofx control to render web pages from web application .Issue is that google map is not rendering in the gecko browser embedded in wpf application , Although other contents/element except google map components of the same page are getting displayed in the geocko embedded wpf control(WindowsFormsHost). But when we open the same page in Firefox browser ,it is working fine. It seems like the issue might be related to how Geckofx handles certain JavaScript or rendering features required by Google Maps. Is there any configure or setting that is require to be set in geckofx to get the google map displayed ? or is there anything which is not supported by geckofx ?

title: How to Automate Nutrition Data Extraction from Websites in Firefox?
content:
I frequently track nutritional information from websites like Popeyes Menu USA to log my meals, but manually copying data is inefficient.

I’m looking for a way to automate the extraction of structured data (e.g., calories, macros) from restaurant websites using Firefox. I’ve considered:

Firefox extensions (like Web Scraper or Tampermonkey)

JavaScript-based automation (via Greasemonkey or Selenium)

Firefox’s built-in dev tools for scraping and exporting structured data

Has anyone successfully implemented an automated data extraction workflow in Firefox? Would using an API-based solution be more efficient than web scraping in this case? Any guidance or experience would be appreciated!
